The plants typically have basal leaves with lobed or divided foliage, and they are adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Aconitopsis species are often found in rocky soils and can thrive in regions with limited water availability. These plants are not only ornamental but also play a role in local ecosystems by providing nectar for pollinators.
